Package com.example.letsgogolfing.models

Class FirestoreRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.letsgogolfing.models.FirestoreRepository
public class FirestoreRepository extends Object
Repository class for interacting with the Firestore database.

This class provides methods for performing CRUD operations on the Firestore database. It also provides callback interfaces for handling the results of these operations.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentUserId

      public String getCurrentUserId()
      Gets the current user's ID (username).
      Returns:
      The current user's ID (username).

    • fetchItems

      public void fetchItems(FirestoreRepository.OnItemsFetchedListener listener)
      Fetches all items from the Firestore database. This method retrieves a collection of items stored in Firestore. Each document is converted into an Item object. The method populates a list of Item objects with data from the Firestore documents and passes this list to the FirestoreRepository.OnItemsFetchedListener upon successful retrieval. In case of a failure during the fetch operation, the listener is notified with the exception.
      Parameters:
      listener - The FirestoreRepository.OnItemsFetchedListener callback for handling the results of the fetch operation. It receives a list of Item objects on successful data retrieval or an exception on failure.

    • fetchItemById

      public void fetchItemById(String itemId, FirestoreRepository.OnItemFetchedListener listener)
      Fetches a single item from the Firestore database. This method retrieves a single item from Firestore using the provided item ID. The document is converted into an Item object and passed to the FirestoreRepository.OnItemFetchedListener upon successful retrieval. In case of a failure during the fetch operation, the listener is notified with the exception.
      Parameters:
      itemId - The ID (String) of the item to be fetched.
      listener - The FirestoreRepository.OnItemFetchedListener callback for handling the results of the fetch operation. It receives an Item object on successful data retrieval or an exception on failure.

    • addTag

      public void addTag(String tag, FirestoreRepository.OnTagAddedListener listener)
      Adds a new tag to Firestore and notifies through a callback.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag to be added to Firestore.
      listener - The callback listener for tag addition results.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Item item, FirestoreRepository.OnItemAddedListener listener)
      Adds a new item to Firestore and notifies it through a callback.
      Parameters:
      item - The item data to be added to Firestore.
      listener - The callback listener for item addition results.

    • deleteItems

      public void deleteItems(List<String> itemIds, FirestoreRepository.OnItemDeletedListener listener)
      Deletes a list of items from the Firestore database using a batch operation. This method iterates over a list of item IDs and adds each delete operation to a Firestore batch. Upon successful deletion of all items in the batch, the provided FirestoreRepository.OnItemDeletedListener callback is notified. In case of failure, the callback is notified with the exception.
      Parameters:
      itemIds - A list of item IDs (String) to be deleted.
      listener - The FirestoreRepository.OnItemDeletedListener callback for handling the result of the deletion operation.

    • updateItem

      public void updateItem(String itemId, Item item, FirestoreRepository.OnItemUpdatedListener listener)
      Updates an existing item in the Firestore database. This method converts the Item object into a Map and then sets the updated data in the Firestore document with the specified item ID. Upon successful update, the provided FirestoreRepository.OnItemUpdatedListener callback is notified. In case of failure, the callback is notified with the exception.
      Parameters:
      itemId - The ID (String) of the item to be updated.
      item - The Item object containing the updated data.
      listener - The FirestoreRepository.OnItemUpdatedListener callback for handling the result of the update operation.

    • fetchTags

      public void fetchTags(FirestoreRepository.OnTagsFetchedListener listener)
      Fetches tags from Firestore and notifies it through a callback.
      Parameters:
      listener - The callback listener for tag fetching results.

    • checkUserExists

      public void checkUserExists(String username, FirestoreRepository.OnUserExistenceCheckedListener listener)
      Checks if a user exists in Firestore and notifies it through a callback.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to be checked.
      listener - The callback listener for user existence checking results.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String username, FirestoreRepository.OnUserAddedListener listener)
      Adds a new user to Firestore and notifies it through a callback.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to be added.
      listener - The callback listener for user addition results.

    • deleteImageUriFromItem

      public void deleteImageUriFromItem(String itemId, String imageUri, FirestoreRepository.OnImageUriDeletedListener listener)
      Adds an image URI to an item in Firestore. This method adds the provided image URI to the imageUris array of the item with the specified item ID. Upon successful addition, the provided OnImageUriAddedListener callback is notified. In case of failure, the callback is notified with the exception.
      Parameters:
      itemId - The ID (String) of the item to which the image URI is to be added.
      imageUri - The image URI (String) to be added to the item.
      listener - The OnImageUriAddedListener callback for handling the result of the addition operation.

    • convertItemToMap

      public static Map<String,Object> convertItemToMap(Item item)
      Converts an Item object to a Map for Firestore storage.

      This method takes an Item object and creates a Map where each field of the item is represented by a key-value pair. The keys are field names, and the values are obtained from the corresponding getters in the Item class. The date of purchase is converted to a Timestamp for Firestore storage. The resulting Map can be used to store the item data in Firestore.

      Parameters:
      item - The Item object to be converted to a Map.
      Returns:
      A Map representing the fields of the provided Item object.
